title: Optimize TagStore: replace dual HashSet+Vec with single structure
description:
Agent identified data structure inefficiency in tag generation:
- TagStore at tags.rs:30-34 maintains both HashSet and Vec for same data
- Uses default SipHash which is slow for small handles
- Could use FxHash or AHash since handles are already hashed values
- MEDIUM-HIGH impact on tag-heavy payloads like DogStatsD

title: Optimize throttle: reduce unused_capacity loop iterations
description:
Agent identified O(10) overhead on every throttle request:
- unused_capacity at stable.rs:254-266 iterates all 10 array slots
- deduct_capacity at stable.rs:281-300 same pattern
- wait_for at stable.rs:37-48 calls Instant::now() syscall per loop iteration
- Could use head pointer or cumulative sums for O(1) capacity queries

title: Fix incorrect payloadtool CLI usage in optimization skills
close_reason: Fixed incorrect payloadtool CLI usage in all optimization skills

comments.author: Brian L. Troutwine
comments.text:
The optimization skills (hunt, rescue, review, validate) use incorrect payloadtool CLI syntax throughout. They reference `./target/release/payloadtool <generator> --total-bytes 10000000` but the actual CLI takes a config YAML file as the first argument and has no --total-bytes flag.

Correct CLI from payloadtool.rs:262-279:
  ./target/release/payloadtool <config_path> [--generator-id ID] [--fingerprint] [--verify FILE] [--memory-stats]

Files affected:
- .claude/skills/lading:optimize:hunt/SKILL.md

- .claude/skills/lading:optimize:validate/SKILL.md
- .claude/skills/lading:preflight/SKILL.md

title: Optimize DogStatsD serialization: eliminate double format!() and Display trait overhead
description:
Multiple agents identified significant overhead in DogStatsD serialization:
- Double format!() calls at dogstatsd.rs:608,664 - formats each metric twice
- Display trait impl with cascading write!() at metric.rs:284-551  
- Per-tag HashMap lookups during serialization at metric.rs:298-314
- Estimated 20-35% improvement potential based on similar Apache Common optimization
close_reason: Optimization implemented in commit 8233e5bb - 12.9% memory reduction achieved

title: Optimize OpenTelemetry Trace: eliminate .to_string() and cloning in hot path
description:
Agent identified memory allocation hotspots in OTel trace generation:
- .to_string() calls at trace.rs:182,189-190,337 on pool strings
- Cloning Resource/InstrumentationScope at trace.rs:197-203 on every trace
- Per-span vec allocation at trace.rs:334
- Low difficulty for .to_string() fix, medium for clone elimination

title: Hunt: DogStatsD serialization buffer reuse - SUCCESS
description:
## Hunt Result: SUCCESS

- **Target**: lading_payload/src/dogstatsd.rs:to_bytes_length_prefix_framed, to_bytes_unframed
- **Branch**: blt/optimize-dogstatsd-serialization
- **Technique**: Buffer reuse (eliminate per-metric String allocations)

## Measurements
- **Time**: ~0.6% faster (127.9ms → 127.1ms, within noise)
- **Memory**: **-12.9%** (52.67 MiB → 45.89 MiB)
- **Allocations**: **-8.8%** (111,650 → 101,777)

## Changes Made
1. `to_bytes_unframed`: Replaced `format!("{member}")` with reusable `Vec<u8>` buffer + `buffer.clear()` pattern
2. `to_bytes_length_prefix_framed`: Replaced `Vec<String>` accumulation with single `Vec<u8>` content buffer + format buffer reuse

## Lesson
Buffer reuse pattern (like Apache Common) eliminates per-iteration String allocations. Even when Display trait is still the bottleneck, eliminating intermediate String allocations saves ~13% memory throughput.

Ready for /lading:optimize:review

title: Optimize Fluent payload: replace BTreeMap with faster structure in hot loop
description:
Agent identified O(log N) overhead in Fluent payload generation:
- BTreeMap allocations at fluent.rs:41,63,131,104,117,149
- Up to 32x128=4096 BTreeMap operations per fluent message
- Could switch to SmallVec or Vec with binary search for small maps
- HIGH impact on fluent generator throughput

title: Optimize Syslog5424: buffer reuse instead of format!() allocations
description:
Agent identified allocation overhead in Syslog generation:
- format!() in hot loop at syslog.rs:89-101,117 allocates per message
- Static string .to_string() at syslog.rs:79-80 for hostnames/app_names
- Similar to Apache Common optimization which yielded 17-28% improvement
- Estimated 20-30% throughput improvement
